pkgmetadata.longdescription: Deep Gaussian Mixture Models // Deep Gaussian mixture models as proposed by Viroli and McLachlan (2019) doi:10.1007/s11222-017-9793-z provide a generalization of classical Gaussian mixtures to multiple layers. Each layer contains a set of latent variables that follow a mixture of Gaussian distributions. To avoid overparameterized solutions, dimension reduction is applied at each layer by way of factor models.
